entry.title: Boostrapping an Octopress Blog
entry.content:
After much foot-dragging, I finally sit down and created this blog using Octopress and GitHub Pages. The whole process is rather smooth thanks to well written official document as well as other how-to’s on the internet.

For starter, the generated static pages will be deployed to a free account on GitHub. There are other options, such as the famed Heroku service, however. For now, I took an easy route. I may try to have the static pages deployed on my VPS through the rsync method in the future.

To start a basic Octopress based blog, one needs to:

  1. Installing proper ruby and gem environment;
  2. Cloning the Octopress repo;
  3. Configuring the blog meta info;
  4. Creating blog posts; and
  5. Deploying the blog data.
